1.content:
Jack sighed as he looked through the books on the shelf. Finding any sort of information on his project was proving quite difficult. He had to pick a topic for his European History class, and at the time the history of witchcraft sounded interesting. How everyone went on witch hunts, and magic was supposedly everywhere... but finding books (he had to have at least one book as a source) on the subject was a bitch.

He had now been in the library for a good hour sifting through book after book, but never finding anything helpful. There had to be something! Finally, his eyes settled on an old looking book collecting dust on a shelf. He popped it open and rifled through the pages. It looked good, but he didn't have the time to look into it properly. He had only planned to come for a little bit after dinner, so he would have to check the book out at home. He shut the book, and took it up to the circulation desk. The lady there was apparantly as bored as him, and checked him out with but a couple words. He tossed the old tome into his backpack and got in his car, an old 2001 Civic. He started the reliable import up, and left for home.

"How did the search go?" His mom Christine asked as he walked in the door. Mark was off on a business trip for the weekend, and it was just them and Samantha, so his mom was just watching TV to pass the time.

"Not good. I found one book, but I haven't looked through it yet." He grabbed a coke out of the fridge and made to go upstairs.

"I'm sure you'll find some good stuff eventually, you just have to look harder!" She said. Jack grumbled a reply and went up to his room. He put the coke on his desk and tossed his backpack on his bed. Looking through a dusty old book definately wasn't his idea of a Friday night, but it was better to do it now while there was nothing going on. He pulled the big block out of his bag, and plopped it on the desk, shooting dust out from under it. Just how long had this thing gone unnoticed? He flipped it open and skimmed through the pages. It looked like it was originally some kind of reference book for... what were these? Spells? That's a good sign for what he's looking for.

Finally he came to a page that looked like a gold mine. Sprawled across both pages was a big circle with a pentagram in the middle, like the kind of cheesy shit you always see in a B budget horror movie. It had latin scrawled around the edges, and in the star itself.

"Fuckin' perfect" he whispered. Jack reached over to pop open his coke, and cut his finger on the tab. He cursed, looking at the small cut, and stood up to go wash it off. In doing so, he pushed his hand on the book, and never notice the circle absorb his blood. He came back in the room and saw the circle in the book spinning, with the pentagram spinning in the opposite direction. All he could do is watch with a gaping mouth as the symbols literally floated off of the page and hovered a foot off of his desk.

He turned his head as a silent flash went off, and when he looked back there was an honest to god naked woman sitting on his desk, cross-legged. She was the most beautiful thing he had ever seen, and looked like she knew it too. She was about his height, and had the tightest body he had ever seen. Her face was slender with smooth lips and deep emerald eyes. Her bust was large, but appeared to float off of her chest rather than sag. She also had dark red hair that flowed down her back that he wanted run his hands through. Actually, he wanted to run his hands all over her.

"Well, at least you're not an ugly son of a bitch like everyone else looking for an easy lay." She said, but he had no idea what she was talking about. Hell, he still had no clue what was even going on.

"Who are you?" He asked. "How did you just...appear?" The sexy mystery in front of him tilted her head.

"I know you are the summoner, I feel your blood running through my veins. Didn't you know what would happen?"

"What? The last thing I saw was the circle thing float out of the book, and then poof! You were here! I didn't do anything. And why are you naked?"

"Of course the summoning circle floated out of the tome, that is what it's supposed to do. When you give your blood to the book, that's what happens. How could you not know that? And of course i'm naked, I'm a succubus. What kind of warlock are you?"

"Ok, hold on. I must have gotten blood from my cut... oh. Oh, damn. Ok. This is all a mistake, I'm no warlock, and I have no clue what's going on. You need to go back in the book." She was hot, but he had no idea what to do, and if his mom caught him sneaking women into his room then she would kill him. The woman on his desk laughed.

"I can't. Once you summon me, I'm here to stay. I'm the guide to this book; both it and I are in your possession for the remainder of your lifetime." He shook his head trying to process everything. Right now, though, she needed to be gone.

"Well you can't be here! If my mom finds you-" The woman shook her head now.

"She won't." At his (even more) confused look, she explained. "Right now, nobody but you can sense me. If you wish, I could make myself noticed but until that time nobody will know I'm here. Part of the book's attempt to stay with you, is to not be stolen." He sighed in relief, and sat down on his bed. He was coming out of his initial shock and trying to replay everything she has said. Also, it was awkward just staring at the naked woman.

"Ok first, what's your name?" He asked.

"Lilith, Master." She said. He was about to respond, but was thrown off by the Master thing.

"Master...?" He asked.

"Obviously you really have no clue what's going on." At his vigorous nod of agreement, she began to explain. "This book," she held it up, "is one of the ancient tomes of the warlocks. Several types of magic have guides to them, and they are often broken up into different subjects. I'm a succubus bound to this book, the book of lust and love." He whipped his head up at that, and she smiled a knowing smile at him. "The books of the warlocks have lots of enchantments and bindings in them and require lots of magical energy to stay together, and there happens to be alot of such energy in the essence of the body, blood. That's where blood binding comes in. In exchange for blood, the book, and all that is in it, belongs to you. And that includes me." His eyes went wide at that and she licked her lips.

"The book can teach you many things, as it is a guide in that area of magic. I myself have quite a range of powers, just not as much as the holder of the book would have."

"What kinds of things can you do?" he asked. There were a million other things he could have said, but dammit he was curious.

"Many things Master, but since you're new to magic, I'll make this simple. Remember how you asked me why I was naked?" She asked, and Jack was now red as a tomato. She hopped off the desk and stood in front of him. "Shapeshifting is one of my powers, especially helpful as a sex demon." He watched as she shifted into the same appearance, with clothes on. She had on knee-high boots, skinny jeans, and a tank top that put her cleavage on display. Even though he missed looking at those tits, this wasn't really a downgrade. "How do I look?" She asked, pushing out her chest.

"I...I...Um, what else can you do?" He asked. That was stupid! Real smooth, Jack. He normally wasn't bad with girls, but she had such a sexual aura, it was distracting him.

"Many things. Turning people on, off, really anything about sex. I can even take over other people if that's what you want. Oh, and before we do anything, I should probably tell you something." He perked up even more at that. "Because of your new power, girls will find you more attractive. At first, most of it will be from being around me, so when you're by yourself it will be weak. But as you grow stronger, so too will your sexual aura. You'll get many women Master, but if I could ask..."

"Yeah?" He was deep in thought, and the newest revelation was but many that he was having to sift through now.

"Save some for me." That brought him out of his thoughts.

"What do you want to do now?" She asked. "It's gotta be weird to be dumped into the magical world so roughly, even though I like it rough." She had obviously taken a liking to her young new master.

"So... you sure no one can hear you?" Jack asked, paranoid. If anyone in his family caught him with a woman in his room...

"Yes, Master. I'm sure." Lilith responded. "But you can check if you don't believe me."

Jack slowly opened his door, and looked out. No one. Then, behind him, he heard a voice.

"Who you talking to, Jack?" It was his sister Jenny. She wasn't home super often, but must have just walked in.

"Umm... no one." Jack mumbled.

"Well it's an interesting conversation to be having with 'no one', Jack." Jenny stated. "You're pretty weird, bro."

"How much did you hear? Jack asked, worried.

"Well I walked past right around 'why are you naked', then I heard all this nonsense about warlocks." Jenny replied. "That's some strange stuff you're into. Who's in there with you,anyway? I couldn't hear anyone else."

"I told you, no one." Jack replied, unconvincing.

"Then you won't mind if I have a look?" Jenny asked. At that moment, Lilith stepped out.

"Told you no one could hear me, Master." Lilith said as she walked up to Jenny. Jack stood, not sure what to do. Jenny didn't seem to notice Lilith come out of the room.

Jenny moved past you, and began to open the door to your room. At the same time, Lilith stepped in line behind her. Jenny took one more step, and Lilith took 2. Lilith seemed to push into Jenny for a second, then disappeared, leaving a thin trail of black smoke. Jenny froze.

Then, Jenny turned around to face Jack, smiled and winked, then proceeded to walk back to her room. Jack quietly made his way into his room, half expecting to see Lilith in there. She wasn't. Jack sat at his desk and proceeded to leaf through the book. The pages didn't make any sense, so he closed the book. At that moment, Lilith walked in through the door. Through the closed door.

"Alright, point taken. People can still hear you." Lilith said casually, as if she hadn't just done something unusual like walk through a solid door. She began chanting, and after a couple of seconds Jack felt a wave of force permeate the room. He didn't know how he felt it, but it was definitely there.

"Umm... what was that?" Jack asked.

"Simple shielding spell. It'll stop anyone hearing what happens in here." Lilith said. "Oh and by the way, Jenny has a pretty nice body, you should try it out sometime..."

"What?" Jack asked.

"Anyway. I noticed you were looking at the book. Bet it didn't make any sense, huh." Lilith cut him off.

"It didn't... What did you..." Jack started.

"It's because you haven't got enough power yet. There are a few ways you can build that up. Some are... more fun than others." Lilith teased, her form shimmering. In the shimmer, Jack could almost make out some familiar features. "Anyway, you wanted to ask something?"

"Yeah..."

1143.content:
"I want Ms. Watson," Jack declared, looking down as he said it, as though he were not sure how Lilith would react. "Ms. Watson?" Lilith said, "who is that?"


Jack paused again. "She's my teacher . . . a history teacher who gave me the assignment that got me the book that put you here," he said with only a little more confidence than before, "I've always thought she was beautiful." Lilith smiled. "Gave you the assignment that got you me, you say? Well, at least there's a bit of poetic irony in there somewhere." "So how do I do this?" Jack demanded, somewhat uncomfortable but eager at the same time.


"Give her this, Master," Lilith said as she held out her hand, and there appeared in it, in a puff of red smoke, a small vial filled with a glowing red liquid. Jack blinked a couple times, still getting used to the very idea of magic--of things appearing out of nowhere. "What is it?" he asked. "Something to get the beautiful Ms. Watson to lose some of her . . . her inhibitions," Lilith said deviously. "So . . so now what?" Jack asked, "do I look all right?" he said, stepping back to allow Lilith to look him over. He had on faded blue jeans and a black shirt with the words "Van Halen" across the front. The shirt was a bight tight on him, and so there was some extra pudge evident in his belly. He had not shaved in a day or so, which meant he had a bit of a beard growing in, and his hair was a bit of a mess. "You look fine, Master," Lilith lied, thinking he really did not look as well as he might, but also believing that he needed to develop confidence in himself by focusing on things beyond the physical.


"So I just go over to her house and get her to drink this?" Jack asked, having taken the vial of red liquid to hold it up and examine it himself. "Yes," Lilith said, "I think you'll find the lady open to your charms," she declared.


Jack turned and went downstairs, not sure what to think of all this. He walked past his mother without a word as he headed for the door, his mind swimming with apprehension and unknown, unknowably possibility. Jack made his way into the October night with the darkened sky above him. The breeze blew through the trees, and Jack rubbed his arms in order to maintain some warmth as he made his way to his beat-up civic and got in. The old car sputtered to life without great enthusiasm, and Jack pulled out of his driveway and headed in the direction of Ms. Watson's house. He knew where she lived only because he had seen her out getting her mail on occasion, though he had never actually been to her house.


"What am I doing?" Jack asked himself as he drove along through the night. "What am I doing what am I doing what am I doing whatthefuckamidoing?!" he demanded of himself as the absurdity of his current situation sank in. Indeed, the question was a reasonable one. He was about to head to the abode of a beautiful woman--his teacher, an authority figure, no less--and try to get her to drink a vial of liquid given to him by a succubus in the hope that the contents of said vial would so excite and ensnare said teacher that all of her sexual energy would flow out of her body and into his. What wasn't weird . . . right?


Jack pulled into Ms. Watson's driveway and spied the clock on his dashboard. It read 7:48, and Jack took a deep breath. He glanced at himself in the mirror in a search for direction and advice that the mirror, as it turned out, did not provide. He reached down into his pocket and fiddled with the trusty vial, the one he hoped would work its magic tonight. Then, he got out of the car and began the walk to Ms. Watson's door.


He opened the outer door and knocked loudly three times on the wooden door that was behind it. He then stepped back and waited for a few seconds. After a few seconds of waiting, Jack heard shuffling about inside the house, and an outer light clicked on, creating an island of light in the night. Somebody on the other end fiddled with a door lock. A second or two later, the door came open.


There before Jack stood Ms. Shannon Watson, clad in a set of sweat pants and a Penn State sweatshirt. Her hair was a little messy, and she had on a pair of dark-rimmed glasses. It seemed she had not planned to go out for the remainder of the evening. Jack looked her up and down for a couple seconds. This is not the way he remembered her from class.


See, Ms. Watson was a woman of 42 years, and she had long dark hair cascading down from her head to fairly well below her shoulders. She had beautiful white skin, though it was somewhat tanned--just a little. Ms. Watson's body was the stuff of dreams--at least of Jack's dreams. At 42 years old, Ms. Watson was not a young, rock-hard, stick-thin model. She had a rather fully body--delightfully full, actually. Her boobs were jell-like mounds that adorned her chest, jiggling as she stepped. Farther down, there was just the smallest bit of fluff in her belly, which gave way to a set of wide, child-bearing hips, though Ms. Watson actually had no children. Her thighs were nice and thick, though still beautiful. She was not fat in any sense, but it was certainly fair to say she had just the right amount of jiggle in just the right places.


"Mr. Thompson?" she asked, calling to Jack as he stood entranced by the body hidden under her rather un-elegant evening-ware. "Mr. Thompson?" she said again. Jack pried his gaze from her chest. "Oh, ah, hi Ms. Watson," Jack said, "I know it's a bit late, and it's Friday, but, ah . . . " "Mr. Thompson, this is very odd," she said, "as you said, it's Friday, and I'm not accustomed to having students at my home."


"I know, but I have a question about the project," Jack said nervously, "do . . . do you have just a couple minutes?" he asked. Ms. Watson looked at you for a few seconds and shook her head slightly, seeming to indicate she had other things she wanted to do with her night. Still, she relented. "Come in," she said as she turned around and headed back into the house. Jack's heart beat quickly as he stepped over the threshold and into Ms. Watson's home. He looked about feverishly, like a young kid who has snuck into an R-rated movie and is petrified of being caught. The home was well-appointed, filled with nice furniture, much of it a sort of regal maroon in color, along with a couple sets of cherry wood cabinets in which there were what seemed to be valuable keepsakes.


Ms. Watson continued into the kitchen as you followed her but were still in the living area. "Take a seat," she said as she disappeared behind the kitchen wall, "so what are your questions about the project?" Jack thought furiously. "Oh fuck," he said internally, "I didn't even bother to make up questions to make small talk!" "Um, well," Jack stammered, "I was wondering whether you had a particular structure you wanted the paper to have, like an order to things, or like a particular number of pages," Jack said. "No particular order, and a minimum of twelve pages, both of which are explained in the syllabus I gave out the first day of class," Ms. Watson declared curtly from the kitchen. This did not seem to be going well.


Jack glanced about. Suddenly, he spotted something. Over on the table in front of the TV was a glass--a wine glass, in fact, filled with water. "This is my shot," Jack said quietly to himself as he snuck over to the glass and pulled out his vial, pouring the red liquid into the glass. The new substance fell into the water in puffs, like the way cream billows in cloud-like formations into coffee. Jack watched as the entire glass glowed bright red for a few seconds, then returned to the clear color one expects of water. "Now I just hope she's thirsty," Jack said. He turned around and headed over to a chair and sat down.


A few seconds later, Ms. Watson emerged from the kitchen, her hair tied in a pony-tail behind her head. "Mr. Thompson, did you really come all the way over here on a Friday night to ask me questions you could have answered by reading your materials?" she said as she sat down on the couch. She looked over at Jack. Jack scrambled. "Uh, I, uh, well so what are the sources we're allowed to cite to--" he began, but Ms. Watson cut him off. "No wikipedia," she said, "none at all." And then she did what Jack had so desperately needed. She reached down and grabbed the cup of water and took a few gulps of it. Jack waited with bated breath as his buxom teacher consumed her drink and, with it, Lilith's potion.


"You'd be amazed how many citations I get that are," she began, and then she suddenly stopped. The water glass fell from her hand on to the couch, empty. Ms. Watson's face took on a blank, featureless look. Jack stood up and began to walk over to her as he worried a bit about what this meant. Her eyes suddenly began to glow a bright red, but just for a few seconds, and then they returned to normal. A couple seconds after that, she shook her head as the blank expression on her face was replaced by a more ordinary one. She shook her head as if shaking off a daze while Jack stood a few steps away.


"Ms. Watson, are you all right?" he asked.

Taking it all into account, Jack decides he needs more answers before committing to a course of action that could be irreversible, if not costly, if proven to be wrong. Upon seeing Jacks face firm up, Lilith sighs, having apparently read Jack's intentions, and snapped her fingers, causing the bound Kitsune to be floated to in front of Jack, at eye level.

  "Before you answer, consider a few things 'Lisa'," Jack starts off, showing some hints of disbelief at the foxes name. "I'm not in the mood for games, and my mischievous and sexy compainion - ," Jack gets out, before being interrupted by Lilith.

  "Aww, you do notice and care Master, it makes me all warm and fuzzy inside....or maybe that's just my unquenchable lust for you and sex in general," Lilith teases, interrupting Jack and causing him to slightly wonder if there was a way to silence her momentarily. Seeing the smirk appear on her lips, and her motioning in a universal mouth zipped pantomime, Jack decides to ignore the interruption, and continue.

"As I was saying, I'm not in the mood, and Lilith over there wishes to do things to you that you most likely wouldn't enjoy willingly. That said, as long as you answer truthfully, and don't try anything, I'm willing to offer you a deal at the end of this discussion. Nod if you understand," Jack states seriously, hoping that his impromptu plan might work.

   Hearing the choices before her, the Kitsune nods, and awaits Jacks questions. Seeing this, Jack decides to start off with some simple questions, before moving on to what he really wants to know.

  "Are you actually Lisa, or are you possessing her like Lilith said your species could?" Jack asks.

    Taking a moment to consider it, 'Lisa' finally responds with a surprising answer.

  "A bit of both technically. Another Youkai owed me a favor, and made a type of golem/doll that i could possess for long periods of time, if i'm low on the energy i need. Instead of me having to feast on Lust or human souls, or drain the magic out of other species, i can possess this doll, and use less energy and keep my possible supplies alive. So in answer to your question, I technically am 'Lisa', but I'm also not truly her, as she's a construct," the Kitsune explains.

   Hiding his shock at what magic can do, and somewhat surprised at such an application, Jack refocuses, and schools his features to give nothing away (he hopes).

  "Ok, in that case, I can assume that you were going to use Sarah tonight as a feeding supply tonight, my question is, would she be alright after this, or would she be injured or dead," Jack asks in a tone that sounds slightly angry at the prospect of any answer.

  "She would have been alright, but two or more feedings like I had planned tonight might have killed her, or severely weakened her immune system enough to cause a natural disease to affect her," the fox answers, after realizing that any mis-truth at this point could be potentially worse.

  Sighing in relief, Jack is glad that he caught this in time, even if he hadn't known Sarah was in danger. Turning his attention away from his crush, Jack decides to get towards the important question, before his offer.

   "Aside from you, are there any other supernatural creatures roaming the city, and if so, are they a potential danger to Lilith and I?" Jack questions, hoping that it won't be too bad of an answer.

   Long moments drag on as the Kitsune seems to be pondering how to answer the query, until a gentle shock runs through her system, starting at her exposed tail, and running through her body and ending at the tips of her exposed ears. Shuddering from the pain, and partial pleasure elicited from the jolt, the Kitsune speaks up.

  "Ahh! That was kind of uncalled for, I was merely trying to figure out how to accurately answer his question Baishunpu (1). As to your question, the 'supernatural population' if you wish to call it, fluctuates weekly, if not daily, as many are not limited to mundane transportation. I've seen vampires pop into the city and then hear about them being in Paris, France less than 5 hours after I saw them. I've heard the local gorgon took 3 weeks to move on, while a random basilisk on stayed in town for an hour, before moving on. So there isn't a solid answer to the first part of your question, but as to being a danger to you, yes, as you are right now, the only thing protecting you is your pet Baishunpu. " 'Lisa' finishes, looking slightly smug at the end, before another shock runs through her body again, causing her to moan and shudder more than the previous shock had caused.

  "That wasn't very nice, you should be more respectful towards the mortal that holds your life in his hands, little Meinu (2)." Lilith states in a slightly aggravated tone. Jack wasn't sure if it was because of the constant put downs on her status, or the implied threat Jack faced. Shrugging, Jack decides to finish up, before Sarah shows up and walks into this 'moonlit world'.

  "While I can't agree with her methods, Lilith had a point, I've been cordial with you, when I could have let her have her way with you, especially after you threatened me. In any case, my offer is this, either enter into a contract or bond with me, or have your memory erased by Lilith, who might do something extra to you since you seem to be pissing her off. The only other thing I can offer is a quick death if neither option appeals." Jack says, looking serious and hoping that he doesn't have to kill someone else. Normally he would be against such an action, but when dealing with the supernatural, Jack realizes the normal rules might not apply, if anime, movies, comics, and lore books are anything to go by!

  "Well, there is one other option, but its only valid if she wishes to die Master. You could drain her of her power and essence, essentially turning her mortal, and making yourself at least half-Kitsune and half-Human. It would open up more magic avenues for you, and you would possibly be able to pass yourself off as a Youkia if someone wanted to hunt a new human warlock." Lilith interjects after Jack finishes explaining some options to the bound fox.

   Upon hearing that option, the Kitsune starts squirming in place, and opening her mouth to scream, only to find no sound coming out. Surprised, Jack looks up, and sees a glowing symbol hovering before Lilith's index finger, apparently silencing 'Lisa'. Bemused, and grateful for her quick thinking, Jack nods in appreciation towards Lilith, who smirks back and wiggles her eyebrows, making Jack wonder if he missed something.

   Long minutes later 'Lisa' seems to stop struggling, and her mouth seems to have stopped moving. After another minute of waiting, the glow dissipates from Lilith's finger, and the sound of breathing can be heard from the Kitsune again. Upon realizing that she can be heard again, the Kitsune draws in breath, apparently readying for either screaming or something, before Jack interrupts with a final statement.

  "Continue yelling, and I might decide to let Lilith choose your fate, as I have been waiting to hear what you wanted, you have been acting childishly, which makes me wonder if you can even contemplate your situation. At this point, I'll give you another few minutes to decide, but at this point, I'm thinking of just letting her decide," Jack says, looking annoyed and sounding completely dismissive.

   Silence fills the room again, without magical help this time, as the fox spends almost a minute just staring in shock at Jack's most recent words.

  "Four minutes until I pick something, little Meinu," Lilith whispers loudly next to 'Lisa's' ear, sending a shiver of fear through her.

 Just as time was about to be up, 'Lisa' speaks up.

  "I ...."

"A contract sounds good to me." Jack said. "She's annoying but I don't want to kill her, as such. It won't hurt, right?"

Lilith shakes her head. "No, Master, it won't hurt her. Unfortunately." She shot a malicious look towards the kitsune, who squirmed in place.

"So how do I..."

"Through blood. Every binding contract works through blood, Master. You take her blood in hand, and you cast a binding spell. Don't worry, I'll help with the spell." Then, Lilith grinned. "And the blood..."

'Lisa' squirmed some more, before offering a palm. "Please... don't let her kill me"

"Oh don't worry, little meinu, you'll live." Lilith shot back. "Now stop your games." Seeing Jack's confused look, she explained. "That's a shell, remember? You take her blood and all you'll get is a contract with a very high quality doll. Nothing more."

Jack watched as 'Lisa' winced. "Fine..." she said. Her eyes rolled back into her head, and 'Lisa' collapsed. From her back, ethereal at first, rose the form of a fox. When she emerged completely, she had become completely solid. White with streaks of orange, and most definitely adolescent, she did look very striking - and pretty.

"Pfft. Only one tail." Lilith laughed. "Still just a child playing adult games." Jack raised his eyebrows. Lilith continued. "Kitsune can have up to nine tails, gaining more as their power grows. It's very rare to see more than five, and there have only ever been a handful of known nine-tailed kitsune. This little one has only one, so she can't even shapeshift - just occupy that shell over there."

"So I just..." Jack reached out to the fox, who turned around and shook her tail.

Fast as lightning, Lilith jumped in front of Jack, grabbed Lisa's tail and flung her against the wall. Lisa let out a yelp and crumpled. "Try that again, and I'll bind you." Lilith spat. Not even waiting for Jack to show his confusion this time, she continued. "Even a young kitsune can cast a wicked curse if someone grabs their tail. She was trying to trick you."

Lilith took another step forward, motioning with her hands. Lisa was pulled up the wall by an unseen force until she hung, belly exposed and tail secured, against the wall. Lilith beckoned to Jack, who approached. With great glee she drew a sharp fingernail across Lisa's chin, causing a few droplets of blood to appear. They dropped right into Jack's waiting hand.

Jack made a fist, clenching the blood in his hand. Lilith began to chant, and Jack felt an energy crackle through everyone in the room. It dissipated, and Jack noticed a new feeling. It was subtle, and similar to when he had accidentally summoned Lilith.

"There we go." Lilith said, dropping Lisa to the floor. "She's all yours." Jack noticed Lisa didn't seem any different. "And as a plus, you're now immune to most fox curses."

"Sweet" Jack muttered. "Lisa... or whatever your name is. I'll call you Lisa. You should probably get back in your body."

Lisa nodded and obediently re-possessed her homunculus. Showing more familiar human emotion, Jack noticed she looked defeated. Which she was, in a way. So what now?
